docs.summary: Events that are fired from a Wix Forum.
description: Wix Forum events are fired in your site's backend when certain changes occur in your forum.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that correspond to the event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to the events.
> **Note:** Backend events do **not** fire when previewing your site.
To add an event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your code files if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles a forum post being created looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixForum_onPostCreated(event) { }

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the forum category that was created.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a new forum category is created.
description: The `onCategoryCreated()` event handler runs when a new forum category is created in your site.
The received `CreatedCategory` object contains information about the new category that was created.
> **Notes:**

> +  If you create a category from your published site, `onCategoryCreated()` runs only when you finish defining the settings and click **Create**. If you create a category using the forum settings in the Editor, `onCategoryCreated()` will run with the default settings as soon as you click **Add New Category**. As you continue to define the category settings, `onCategoryUpdated()` will run.
> + Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

examples.title: A backend event that occurs when a new forum category is created
body: // Place this code in a file named events.js
// in the Backend section of your code files.
*    "description": "This is a description of my category.",

extra.description: In this example, the category header background is a color.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the forum comment that was downvoted.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a forum comment is downvoted.
description: The `onCommentDownvoted()` event handler runs when an existing forum comment in your site is downvoted.
The received `DownvotedComment` object contains information about the comment that was downvoted.
> **Notes:**
> + Only comments on posts with a `postType` of `"QUESTION"` can be voted on.
> + Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the forum post that was closed.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a forum post is closed.
description: The `onPostClosed()` event handler runs when an existing forum post in your site is closed.
When a forum post is closed, members can't comment on the post.
The received `ClosedPost` object contains information about the post that was closed.
> **Notes:**
> + By default, forum posts are open.
> + Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

examples.title: A backend event that occurs when a forum post is closed
body: // Place this code in a file named events.js
// in the Backend section of your code files.

docs.summary: An object representing a forum category.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name. Appears on the forum home page and in the navigation menu.

members.name: headerTitle
members.doc: Category header title. Appears in the category page header.

members.name: headerType
members.doc:
Type of header background.
One of the following:

 + `"IMAGE"`: Category header background is an image.
 + `"COLOR"`: Category header background is a color.


The default value is `"COLOR"`.

members.name: headerImage
members.doc: Category header background [image source](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/$w/image/src). Applicable only if `headerType` is an image.

members.name: headerImageOverlayColor
members.doc: Forum category header image overlay color. Applicable only when `headerType` is `"IMAGE"`.

members.name: rank
members.doc: Position in the list of categories on the forum home page. `0` indicates the first category.

members.name: pageUrl
members.doc: Relative URL of the category page.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly name of the category that is unique across the forum.

members.name: postCount
members.doc: Number of posts in the category.

members.name: postViewCount
members.doc: Total views of all posts in the category.

members.name: writeProtected
members.doc: Only admins and moderators can post in this category.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the category was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the category was last updated.

members.name: categoryType
members.doc:
Type of category.
One of the following:


 + `"DISCUSSION"`: Conversational discussion with other members.
 + `"QUESTION"`: Specific question with answers from the community.

docs.summary: An object representing a post that was closed.
An object representing a color used in a forum header.

members.name: opacity
members.doc: Opacity percentage as a decimal between 0 and 1.

docs.summary: An object representing a forum comment.

members.name: postId
members.doc: ID of the post commented on.

members.name: replyCount
members.doc: Number of replies to the comment.

members.name: likeCount
members.doc: Number of likes the comment received.

members.name: upvoteCount
members.doc: Number of upvotes the comment received. Only applicable to comments on posts with a `postType` value of `"QUESTION"`.

members.name: downvoteCount
members.doc: Number of downvotes the comment received. Only applicable to comments on posts with a `postType` value of `"QUESTION"`.

members.name: score
members.doc: Number of upvotes subtracted by the number of downvotes. May be a negative number. Only applicable to comments on posts with a `postType` value of `"QUESTION"`.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the comment was created.

members.name: _editedDate
members.doc: Date and time the comment was last edited.

members.name: _lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date and time of the last activity performed on the comment.

members.name: pageUrl
members.doc: Relative URL of the post page containing the comment.

docs.summary: An object representing a category that was created.
An object representing a comment that was created.
An object representing a post that was created.
An object representing a category that was deleted.
An object representing a comment that was deleted.
An object representing a post that was deleted.
An object representing a comment that was downvoted.
An object representing a comment that was liked.
An object representing a post that was liked.
An object representing a comment that was marked as best.
An object representing a post that was moved to a different category.

members.name: previousCategoryId
members.doc: ID of the category the post moved from.

members.name: currentCategoryId
members.doc: ID of the category the post moved to.

docs.summary: An object representing a post that was opened.
An object representing a post that was pinned.
An object representing a forum post.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of the category the post belongs to.

members.name: pinned
members.doc: Whether the post is pinned. Only forum admins can pin and unpin posts.

members.name: commentingDisabled
members.doc: Whether comments are disabled for the post (the post was closed).

members.name: commentCount
members.doc: Number of comments on the post.

members.name: likeCount
members.doc: Number of likes the post received.

members.name: viewCount
members.doc: Number of times the post was viewed.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the post was created.

members.name: _editedDate
members.doc: Date and time the post was last edited.

members.name: _lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date and time of the last activity performed on the post.

members.name: pageUrl
members.doc: Relative URL of the post page.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly name of the post that is unique across the forum.

members.name: postType
members.doc:
Type of post.
One of the following:


 + `"DISCUSSION"`: Conversational discussion with other members.
 + `"QUESTION"`: Specific question with answers from the community.

members.name: bestAnswerCommentId
members.doc: ID of comment marked as best answer to the post question. Applicable only for posts with a `postType` of `"QUESTION"`.

docs.summary: An object representing a comment that was reported.

members.name: reportType
members.doc:
Type of report.
One of the following:


 + `"OFFENSIVE_CONTENT"`: Content that is offensive.
 + `"OFFENSIVE_MEDIA"`: Media content that is offensive.
 + `"SPAM"`: Comments with unrelated or unwanted information.

docs.summary: An object representing a post that was reported.

members.name: reportType
members.doc:
Type of report.
One of the following:


 + `"OFFENSIVE_CONTENT"`: Content that is offensive.
 + `"OFFENSIVE_MEDIA"`: Media content that is offensive.
 + `"SPAM"`: Posts with unrelated or unwanted information.

docs.summary: An object representing a comment that was unliked.
An object representing a post that was unliked.
An object representing a comment that was marked as best.
An object representing a post that was unpinned.
An object representing a comment that was unvoted.
An object representing a category that was updated.
An object representing a comment that was updated.
An object representing a post that was updated.
An object representing a comment that was upvoted.
